Line: Written by Larry David & Jerry Seinfeld
I hate clothes, okay? I hate buying them. I hate picking them out of my closet. I can't stand every day trying to come up with little outfits for myself. I think
I think I've seen enough.
Well, I might have something in the back.
The back? They never find anything in the back. If they had anything good in the back, they'd put it out in the front.
Why don't they open up an entire store for the back? Call it, "Just Back." All back. No front. You walk in the front, you're immediately in the back. (Picks
Oh, I just read that. That's terrific.
Her father wrote that.
Alton Benes is your father?
Yeah.
I always felt he deserved a wider audience.
I'm not so sure he wants one. Hey, don't forget Sunday, okay? You and George are coming, right? Hotel Westbury, eight o' clock.
What? What, you don't want to go now?
No, I'll go. I'm going.
No, Jerry, you have to. I need a buffer. You know, I haven't seen my father in a while and.. you know.
I'm worried I won't be able to talk to him. He's such a great writer. Frankly, I perfer the company of nitwits.
So, that's why we're not togeter anymore.
What is this? This is beautiful.. but these jackets never fit me right.
Try it on. Wow, this is soft suede.
This may be the most perfect jacket I have ever put on. How much is it?
Oh my God.
Bad? ..Very bad?
You have no idea.
I have some idea.
No idea.
I've got a ballpark.
There is no park and the team has relocated.
..That is high.
Oh man, that is a beautiful jacket, though.
What's with the pink lining and the candy stripes?
Well, it's just a lining. You can always have it changed.
Should I get it? I hate these moments. I'm hearing the dual voices now, you know. "What about the money?" "What's money?"
It looks wonderful on you.
Hey.
Hey. New jacket?
What do you think?
It's beautiful.
Is it me?
That's definitely you.
Really?
That's more you than you've ever been. What is with the pink lining?
I don't know. It's got a pink lining.
Oh.. So, what did you pay for this?
I paid what it costs.
How much?
What's the difference?
What, you're not gonna tell me?
I'd rather not say it out loud. It's embarrassing.
Over three hundred?
Yes, but let's just stop it right there.
It's over four hundred?
Really, I'm not answering anymore.
Is it over four hundred?
Would you?
Woah, Nelson!
I know, I know.
What are you gonna do with the leather one?
I don't know.
Well, are you gonna wear it?
Maybe.
You're not going to wear this.
Do you want it?
Well, yeah. Okay. I'll take it.. I like the jacket.
..Okay, take it.
Good karma for you. Oh baby.
"Master of the house.. doling out the charm, ready with a handshake and an open palm. Tells a saucy talke, loves to make a stir everyone appreciates a.."
What is that song?
Oh, it's from Les Miserables. I went to see it last wee. I can't get it out of my head. I just keep singing it over and over. It just comes out. I have no
You know, Schumann went mad from that.
Artie Schumann? From Camp Hatchapee?
No, you idiot.
What are you, Bud Abbott? What, are you calling my an idiot?
You don't know Rober Schumann? The composer?
Oh, Schumann. Of course.
He went crazy from one note. He couldn't get it out of his head. I think it was an A. He kept repeating it over and over again. He
Really? ..Well, what if it doesn't stop? Oh, that I really needed to hear. That helps a lot! Alright, just
I know exactly what's goin to happen tonight. I'm gonna try and act like I'm not impressed, he's gonna see right through it.
Yeah, he'll be looking at us like he's backstage at a puppet show.
Let me just get my jacket.
"Master of the house, keeper of the inn.." This is huge!
Wednesday. This jacket has completely changed my life. When I leave the house in this, it's with a whole different confidence. Like tonight, I might've been
Can I say one thing to you? And I say this wiht an unblemished record of staunch heterosexuality.
Absolutely.
..It's fabulous.
I know.
And I'll tell you something else, I'm not even going to ask you. I want to know. But I'm not going to ask. You'll tell me when you feel comfortable.. So
Hey. Hey, would you do me a solid?
Well, what kind of solid?
I need you to sit in the car for two minutes while it's double-parked. I gotta pick up some birds.
Birds?
Yeah. A friend of mine, he's a magician. He's going away on vacation. He asked me to take care of his doves.
So take a cab.
They won't take a cage full of birds.
I can't. I'm on my way out. There's no way I can do it.
George, do me a solid? Two minutes.
Well, I'm going with him. I'd like to, I've never done a solid before.
Alright.. yeah.. alright, have a good one.
Two minutes. Believe me, I know his two minutes.. By his conception of time, his life will last over two thousand years.
"Master of the House. Quick to catch your eye, never wants a passerby to pass him by."
Schumann. Where are they?
Maybe he didn't show up.
What, you don't want to do this?
I don't think there's ever been an appointment in my life where I wanted the other guy to show up.
Wait a second, is that him?
Yeah, I think it is. Where's Elaine?
I'm nervous.
Excuse me.. Mister Benes?
Yeah?
I'm Jerry. Elaine's friend.. and this is George.
It's a great thrill to meet you, Sir.
Sit down. Want a drink?
Sure.
What do you have?
I'll have a cranberry juice with two limes.
And, I'll have a club soda with no ice.
I'll have another Scotch with plenty of ice.
You like ice?
Huh?
I said, do you like ice?
Like it?
Don't you think you get more without it?
Where's Elaine?
Well, we thought she was meeting you earlier. She's usually pretty punctual. ..Don't you find that, George?
Yeah, yeah. She's punctual.. and she's been late sometimes.
Yeah, yeah. Sometimes she's on time, and sometimes she's late.
I guess today she's late.
It appears that way.
Yep.
Yep.
Looks like rain.
I know, I know, that's what they said.
Who said?
The weather guy, Dr. Waldo.
I don't need anybody to tell me it's gonna rain.
No, of course not. I didn't..
All I have to do is stick my head out the window. Which one's suppose to be the funny guy?
Oh, he's the comedian.
I'm just a regular person.
No, no. He's just being modest.
We had a funny guy with us in Korea. A tailgunner. They blew his brains out all over the Pacific. There's nothing funny about that.
Would you excuse me a minute? I'm gonna go to the bathroom. I'll be right back.
I just wanted to tell you that I really enjoyed Fair Game. I thought it was just brilliant.
Drivel.
Maybe some parts.
What parts?
The drivel parts.. Oh my gosh, I just realized - I have to make a phone call. I can believe.. would you..
Thank you for leaving me alone with him!
That was brutal. I can't go back out there.
Well, let's just leave.
Elaine'll kill me.
Where is she?
She's gotta be here soon.
How could she leave us alone with this lunatic? Ten more minutes, and that's it! I'm leaving. I have to tell you, this guy scares me.
The waiter was trembling.
If she doesn't show up, we can't possibly have dinner with him alone.
How are we gonna get out of it?
We'll say we're frightened and we have to go home.
Yeah, that's good. He'd clunk our heads together like Moe.
I don't know. Just start scratching. Tell him you have the crabs. He was in the military. He'll understand that.
All fathers are intimidating. They're intimidating because they are fathers. Once a man has children, for the rest of his life, his attitude is, "To hell with the
Who'd you call?
My uncle is having an operation. I just wanted to see how he was.
What kind of operation?
Bone marrow.
Mister Benes?
Yes?
A message for you.
From Elaine. She got tied up. She'll be here in thirty minutes.
Yeah, they should've taken care of Castro when they had the chance. Like we did in Guatamala in 'fifty-three.
Well, Guatamala.
Sure, Guatamala.
Alright, you boys get yourselves together. We'll head up to the restaurant. I'll leave a note for Elaine. I'm going to the bathroom.
Come on, let's go!
What about Elaine?
To hell with Elaine!
She'll be furious.
We're dying here!
That's her! She's here!
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. Where is Dad?
He's in the bathroom.
Where have you been?!
Kramer, that .. Kramer! I'm just about to leave, he calls me up. He begs me to sit in his car for two minutes, so he can pick up these birds..
Oh, you didn't..
Well, he said he'd drive me here right after. So, I am sitting in his car twenty minutes! he doesn't come down. I am freezing. Then a cop comes by, tells me
Great.
Couldn't be better.
Good. 'Cause Dad can make some people a little uncomfortable.
Oh, no, no.
Get outta here..
Man, Kramer! I could kill him.
I can't believe it. You know better than to get involved with Kramer.
He said he'd give me a lift.
Ah, the lift. Like the lure of the siren's song. Never what it seems to be, yet who among us can resist?
Where do you come up with this stuff?
Well, look who's here.
Oh, Hi, Dad.
Hello, dear. Who's the lipstick for?
No one.
..How's your mother?
Fine.
How about you? Are you working?
Yeah, I'm reading manuscripts for Pendant Publishing. I told you ten times.
Pendant, those bastards.. Alright, boys. We'll go to that Pakistani restaurant on 46th Street. You're not afraid of a little spice, are you?
"Master of the house, doling out the charm. Ready with a handshake and an open.."
Pipe down, chorus boy.
Ohh.. it's snowing. It's beautiful.
Snow.. snow, that can't be good for suede, can it?
I wouldn't think so.
What should I do? We're taking a cab, aren't we?
Cab? It's only five blocks.
Why don't you just turn it inside out?
Inside out! Great.
Wait a minute. What the hell do you call this?
Oh, I turned my jacket inside out.
Well, you look like a damn fool!
Well, it's a new suede jacket. It might get ruined.
Well, you're not going to walk down the street with my and my daughter dressed like that! That's for damn sure!
It's only a few blocks.
Elaine?
Yeah.
Come on up.
Hey.
Hey.
I've gotta feed the birds.
So?..
You got any of those mini Ritzes?
I can't believe I do.
Yeah! ..Well, are you going out?
Yeah.
Hey, where's your new jacket? What? (Kramer enters the bathroom,
I was out in the snow last night.
Don't youk now what that does to suede?
I have an idea. We can make the nine-thirty at Cinema III.
Okay.. Hello. Listen, thanks again for coming last night. Dad said he had a great time.
Is he still in town?
No, he's driving back to Maryland tonight.
So, uh.. what are you gonna do with that one now?
I don't know.
Well?..
I didn't want to tell you this, but usually he hates everyone.
Really?
You gonna throw this out?
Well, I can't wear it.
Yeah, he like you though. Said you reminded him of somebody he knew in Korea.
Well, if you're just gonna throw it out, you know, I could take it.
Yeah, go ahead, take it.
Dad thinks George is gay.
Oh, because of all that singing?
No, he pretty much thinks everyone is gay.
Hey, see, I like it like this.
Isnt' that..? Oh, is this fromt he snow last night? Ugh.. you know what you
I'll try and remember that.
Boy, it's too bad you gave me this one too.
Yeah, too bad.
I'm gonna have to do something about this lining.
"Master of the house doling out the charm, ready with a handshake and an open palm.."
I had a leather jacket that got ruined. Now, why does moisture ruin leather? I don't get this. Aren't cows ouside most of the time? I don't understand it.
